reviews.review:
This games campaign.

Oh my, did this games campaign shake me.

Especially with the damn achievements.

9/10

The classic of modern co-op games.

While it might seem a bit simple in terms of variety compared to some modern co-op games, it still holds pretty well and can provide a decent amount of entertainment.

For those who dont know, you are a group of survivors trying to navigate the zombie apocalypse in order to survive. There are 4 people, either players or NPCs, that need to get from one point to another, picking up whatever weaponry can help them along the way. Story is limited, but pleasant. Enemies can be quite challenging depending on the difficulty. 

Good stuff, go for it.

8/10

A game i use to play a lot with a great friend, this game brings back great memories of simple times where you got on a game and just killed some zombies and had fun, no loot box's, no skins to worry about, just point A to point B fun and gun & though times have changed & friends even the best come and go, left 4 dead 1 still exist the same as it once was when i first picked it up  on Xbox 360 10 years ago, 

9/10 game only marred by its sometimes wonky AI and games bug
Unutulmaya yüz tutmuş oyunlar arasında kendisi. Elbette bir nesil çok oynamıştır ama ben oynamadım ve şuanda oynayan da yok zaten.
Been playing this game since XBox 360, and it still holds up.
Добротное , весёлое зомби мочилово, С друганами вечером-другим самое то.
Un muy buen juegazo para pasarlo con amigos 7u7
"I guess we were left 4 dead" - somebody in the game probably, Idk I didn't play it
5/10 - So much fun but I recommend skipping this one and playing L4D2.

I personally like this game better than its sequel , i never expected i was going to fall in love so hard with this game so much.

Over 12 years later this game still rocks and is still one of the best co-op games out there , it still has a surprisingly large community which is also very active , i rarely find servers with AI-Controlled players , the game's co-op is so masterful that it feels like you are stuck in an actual post-apocalyptic city with your teammates/friends and all of you have to work together as a team to survive

The graphics still look top notch to this day , Valve always gave this sense of realism in their games without trying to hard , combining old school flat & blocky style with modern textures , a remaster for this masterpiece would be just a cash grab.

The atmosphere , score and soundtrack are also nutty , i know what is(or is about) to happen instantly depending on how the soundtrack changes.

The environment are dark and beautiful , rooms in various buildings painted with blood , telling the stories of the survivors of the Green Flu , Valve really nailed it with their style of environmental story telling , there are no annoying cutscenes , all the story is told as you go along thru this  hellish world full of zombies.

One thing i do not understand it the lack of melee weapons of any kind , i know L4D2 was praised for its weapon variety but never understood why Valve won't implement even a damn crowbar in the first game , this game also deserves a community update just like its successor  
, Valve trusted a fan dev-team to make a remake for the game that kickstarted their whole career yet they won't allow melee weapons to be implemented? The game would be so much fun!
(Now that i am complaining about the lack of melee weapons , most of you reading this might just say " Why don't you just play the second game? It has all the maps and overall more of everything". 

I want to draw a line between L4D and L4D2 and make-out the differences.

L4D is a badass survivor horror , while L4D2 feels more of a comedy , compare 28 Weeks later with Shawn of the Dead.The atmosphere is just different , the graphics in the second game also feel very heavyweight , i personally played the second game a little bit just for the extensive lore , but L4D won my hearth in the first place <3.

as someone who played this to death back when it first came out, i'm extra glad to see it still holds up well. i should note that i've always been partial to L4D1, but i jumped in thinking that the new additions in the sequel would spoil me to the point that i'd find this one unplayable. 

50 hours later, i've been proven wrong. the core experience itself is quite the thrill that i can't put into words adequately, and somehow the hordes + the old Special Infected roster are harder to manage than i remember, even on Normal. the lack of a cooldown meter while shoving more than makes up for the limited set of weapons, in my opinion, and what weapons are available have that punch that i feel Half-Life 2's guns never had. 

the biggest setback you'll encounter, as well as the one reason i cannot recommend this game to anyone, is the sheer lack of players: as of the time this was written, Steamcharts counts 571 survivors in-game, while L4D2 sits at an enviable 23,917—and even with the former's surprisingly dedicated community, you'll find trolls and douchebags just as dedicated. par for the course, i guess, although i still can't help feeling disappointed by the odd teamkiller. 

i'd only suggest picking this up if, even after all this time, you're still mad at Valve for announcing Left 4 Dead 2 so soon after the first; otherwise, you'll definitely find more to love in the sequel, along with more players to kill zombies with.

1. [u]Graphics[/u] [i]9/10[/i] (I liked the first version of [i]Left 4 Dead[/i] too much. Although, I've been playing the '[i]big update[/i]' version of that game for hours. I prefer the first version for two important aspects. The first aspect is [u]the proposal of a narrative without text, without notes, without collectables files[/u]. Of course, the game has a complex and detailed story. The story of the game is proposed through images placed inside each campaign. The second aspect is about the creation of the game characters. The four characters are well made, from the lines of dialogue to the unfolding of the story in each campaign. The purpose: the four must stick together to survive. In fact, this game has a very raw story, with many details and a tragedy as a denouement of story to those four survivors, or rather three survivors.) 

2. [u]Playability[/u] [i]9/10[/i] (I can't describe enough about the playability. The controls are basic and easy to operate. You‘ll take items needed to survive. But yes, [i]you can find many bugs and glitches in the whole game[/i]. One more thing, [spoiler]something that has remained in the game is the chance to observe the feet of the characters[/spoiler]. A detail that was lost in the second game. Just as it has happened with some items and HUD of the game.)

3. [u]Music and FX[/u] [i]7/10[/i] (The soundtrack is intended for only special enemies, hordes and the existence of the metal version for the Tank. Many times you‘ll hear ambient sounds. Or some parts with tension music, like the climax of game. In my opinion, in the game has worked more on the ambient music and enemy sounds than the soundtrack. Different from the second game, where prevails a more complex development of music.)

4. [u]Duration[/u] [i]8/10[/i] (Originally, the game had four campaign. It can be said that it has a considerable duration, although the game seems short but with many details of the story and narration for the characters. Each image is an easter egg that is related to another game, or offers some details of the famous disease called the [i]green flu[/i]. [spoiler]You can speedrun and forget about the narration of the game, like it never mattered[/spoiler]. Subsequently, two more campaigns were added: [i]Crash Course[/i] and [i]The Sacrifice[/i]. Both campaigns are good. If you haven't played it, I won't say the possible outcome of the game. By the way, something that I liked a lot is the posters of the game. Each campaign has its own poster and design. For cooperative or solo mode with various difficulties. Versus and Survival maps have been added and one map has been highlighted: [i]The last stand[/i].)

[h1]Recommendation: 9/10[/h1]

Pozitívumok:
- Zoey, hihetetlenül jól el lett találva, a grafikus és a modellező megérdemelte a prémiumot
- modok
- pályatervezés
- magasabb nehézségi szinten az erő sokszor semmire nem jó, a taktika alap
- dinamikus játékmenet, bár néha lehet azért sunyulni is
- szinkron, mindegyik telitalálat

Negatívumok:
- kevés mod, de a L4D2 mod-közössége kárpótol mindenért
- Billnek kellene valami nikotintapasz
- gyenge fegyverek (ezt a modokkal lehet változtatni)

Egy általános megjegyzés: Ha valaki nagyon sokat játszik ezzel vagy a folytatással, felfigyel rá, hogy egyetlen hangulat van megcélozva, ami unalmassá válik egy idő után. Mindig, mindenki kemény, laza, rettenthetetlen, az élményt csak ezzel próbálják megragadni, holott a szituációban rengeteg komolyság rejlik, van helye a horrornak, félelemnek, drámának, nyomasztó kilátástalanságnak, a működő taktika kitalálása önmagában eléggé izgalmas - szerencsére a modokkal minden orvosolható.
Эту игру я рекомендую! Интересный сюжет и крутая атмосфера зомби-апокалипсиса.
In my opinion this game still holds up for a game released in 2008.  Very solid first person shooter and one of the great zombie video games.  Cooperative play is extremely fun and addicting.
verry goodI really like this game, when I was in school, and between the times I play this game is very memorial

Tek Kelime İle Mükemmel Bir Oyun.

Incredibly fun, co-op action thriller.


This game, although being old, is great for it's age. There are many campaigns for you to do, Whether you're alone or are playing with friends they are all a blast to play. 


I think the shotgun may be a little more powerful than the SMG and Assault Rifle.


In my opinion, this game is perfect if you need something to play with friends. 

8/10 - User

The inability to walk around on an overmap and revisit previous towns really hurts the immersiveness of this game compared to the second one. The enemy AI is really poor as well, and it leaves many of its units just standing around doing nothing the entire battle. Some characters are blatantly more powerful than others to the point where you just won't even use some of them, and the level-ups are waaaaay too random. The art is still okay, but pretty unpolished compared to the second game. For an early tactical RPG this wasn't a bad game *at the time*, but there's little reason to play it now.

Good alternatives would be Minecraft, GarageBand or Pathfinder 2E.

3 out of 10
Recomando al 100% puede ser algo aburrido pero si lo ves de otra manera es divertido y mas difcil xq no ahi armas melees :v

Игра классная, с хорошим геймплеем. Потянет она на любой микроволновке, так что можете не бояться потянет ли она в вас. В игре вам нужно просто переходить из точки А в точку В, отбиваясь от орды зомби. В игре есть кооператив, так что можете звать своих друзей и фаниться. Игру прошёл за пару вечеров и мне понравилось, взял вторую часть и она мне тоже понравилась. Так что советую брать своих друзей, брать две части игры и расстреливать всех зомби на своем пути.
Hermoso recuerdos , cuando era niño y me asustaba con este juego 😂🤣
